channel.title: Feeds Student Journalism and feeds about Journalism feeds

item.title: Bruins bounce back against Terrapins as men’s basketball snaps losing streak
item.description: It was not quite the Los Angeles Dodgers versus the Oklahoma City Comets on Saturday, but it was the lopsided matchup the Bruins seemed to need amid their two-game skid.
item.source:markdown: It was not quite the Los Angeles Dodgers versus the Oklahoma City Comets on Saturday, but it was the lopsided matchup the Bruins seemed to need amid their two-game skid.

item.title: Bruin Food Access Project, attorneys help make CalFresh more accessible
item.description: Confusing income calculations and time-consuming application processes can make CalFresh – California’s version of the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program – difficult to access, Yasmeen Washington, a law student, said.
item.source:markdown: Confusing income calculations and time-consuming application processes can make CalFresh – California’s version of the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program – difficult to access, Yasmeen Washington, a law student, said.

item.title: UCLA gymnastics takes 3rd, podiums at Sprouts Farmers Market Collegiate Quad
item.description: This post was updated Jan. 10 at 4:38 p.m. An opportunity for revenge goes unfulfilled. With three of the four 2025 NCAA finalists in the field, the Bruins had an opportunity to set the tone early in 2026 but ultimately fell short.
item.source:markdown: _This post was updated Jan. 10 at 4:38 p.m._ An opportunity for revenge goes unfulfilled. With three of the four 2025 NCAA finalists in the field, the Bruins had an opportunity to set the tone early in 2026 but ultimately fell short.

item.title: Proposed state budget includes $350 million increase to UC amid federal cuts
item.description: Gov. Gavin Newsom proposed a state budget Friday for the 2026-27 fiscal year that included an increase of $350.6 million in funding to the UC.  The UC would receive $5.3 billion from the state’s general fund, based on the proposal.
item.source:markdown: Gov. Gavin Newsom proposed a state budget Friday for the 2026-27 fiscal year that included an increase of $350.6 million in funding to the UC. The UC would receive $5.3 billion from the state’s general fund, based on the proposal.

item.title: UCLA gymnastics heads to Utah for Sprouts Farmers Market Collegiate Quad
item.description: No one is immune to season-opening jitters. But the youthful Bruin squad managed to find balance in its Jan. 3 season-opener – ending the meet with their highest season-opening beam total since 2004.
item.source:markdown: No one is immune to season-opening jitters. But the youthful Bruin squad managed to find balance in its Jan. 3 season-opener – ending the meet with their highest season-opening beam total since 2004.

item.title: Bruins strive to cement perimeter prowess, strengthen defense in Maryland match
item.description: Stephen Curry helped transition basketball from the paint to the 3-point line. Consequently, shooting and perimeter defense have become staples of every championship-caliber team. Coach Mick Cronin has embraced a defensive-centered approach throughout his coaching career, molding squads that stifle opposing players.
item.source:markdown: Stephen Curry helped transition basketball from the paint to the 3-point line. Consequently, shooting and perimeter defense have become staples of every championship-caliber team. Coach Mick Cronin has embraced a defensive-centered approach throughout his coaching career, molding squads that stifle opposing players.

item.title: Q&A: Mary E. Brunkow shares research journey, urges scientific curiosity
item.description: “Scurfy” mice, DNA sequencing and a Seattle biotechnology company were integral to the research that Mary E. Brunkow conducted to win the 2025 Nobel Prize in physiology or medicine.
item.source:markdown: “Scurfy” mice, DNA sequencing and a Seattle biotechnology company were integral to the research that Mary E. Brunkow conducted to win the 2025 Nobel Prize in physiology or medicine.

item.title: LA Metro staff recommend transit project alternative including UCLA stop
item.description: Los Angeles Metro staff recommended a modified version of alternative five of the Sepulveda Transit Corridor Project – which includes a station on UCLA’s campus – to the LA Metro board’s planning and programming committee Friday.
item.source:markdown: Los Angeles Metro staff recommended a modified version of alternative five of the Sepulveda Transit Corridor Project – which includes a station on UCLA’s campus – to the LA Metro board’s planning and programming committee Friday.

item.title: Former five-star QB Husan Longstreet enters transfer portal
item.description:
The freshman likely did not want to spend a second year as redshirt junior quarterback Jayden Maiava’s backup.

The post Former five-star QB Husan Longstreet enters transfer portal appeared first on Daily Trojan.

item.title: Trump mischaracterizes Undie Run video as reaction to Nicolas Maduro capture
item.description: President Donald Trump mischaracterized a video of UCLA students participating in the quarterly Undie Run as Venezuelans celebrating the ousting of deposed President Nicolas Maduro in a post to his social media platform Truth Social on Sunday.
item.source:markdown: President Donald Trump mischaracterized a video of UCLA students participating in the quarterly Undie Run as Venezuelans celebrating the ousting of deposed President Nicolas Maduro in a post to his social media platform Truth Social on Sunday.

item.title: Op-ed: UCLA must build on-campus football stadium to reclaim athletic identity
item.description: UCLA’s recent football coaching hire has done what years of messaging could not: It has created real optimism on campus. Students are paying attention again. Alumni are engaged.
item.source:markdown: UCLA’s recent football coaching hire has done what years of messaging could not: It has created real optimism on campus. Students are paying attention again. Alumni are engaged.

item.title: Freshman Nola Matthews begins UCLA gymnastics career with artistry, horror themes
item.description: Reputations are imperative. And the Bruins have one to uphold. UCLA gymnastics finished the 2025 campaign as the top ranked floor team in the nation. The team is known for its “floor parties” marked by unique routines, cohesive choreography and innovative music.
item.source:markdown: Reputations are imperative. And the Bruins have one to uphold. UCLA gymnastics finished the 2025 campaign as the top ranked floor team in the nation. The team is known for its “floor parties” marked by unique routines, cohesive choreography and innovative music.

item.title: Q&A: Ninez Ponce talks Asian American representation, equity in health care
item.description: Ninez Ponce, a professor and endowed chair in the UCLA Fielding School of Public Health, sat down with Daily Bruin News contributor Jiyoon Choi to discuss representation in healthcare and the California Health Interview Survey, which she leads.
item.source:markdown: Ninez Ponce, a professor and endowed chair in the UCLA Fielding School of Public Health, sat down with Daily Bruin News contributor Jiyoon Choi to discuss representation in healthcare and the California Health Interview Survey, which she leads.

item.title: UCLA Fit for Health Program adopts holistic approach to childhood obesity
item.description: The UCLA Fit for Health Program adopted a new approach to treating childhood obesity: considering the physical, emotional and social aspects of the disease. Dr. Wendelin Slusser, a UCLA Health physician who specializes in clinical care, medical training and obesity research, founded the clinic about 15 years ago.
item.source:markdown: The UCLA Fit for Health Program adopted a new approach to treating childhood obesity: considering the physical, emotional and social aspects of the disease. Dr. Wendelin Slusser, a UCLA Health physician who specializes in clinical care, medical training and obesity research, founded the clinic about 15 years ago.

item.title: Uncertainty for AmeriCorps leads to less support, planning concerns for CA programs
item.description: Federal funding cuts have left the futures of thousands of volunteering opportunities for California college students uncertain since April 2025. The Trump administration withheld more than $184 million in grants from AmeriCorps, which provides funding to a variety of community service programs – mainly focusing on education, public health and environmental stewardship – last spring.
item.source:markdown: Federal funding cuts have left the futures of thousands of volunteering opportunities for California college students uncertain since April 2025. The Trump administration withheld more than $184 million in grants from AmeriCorps, which provides funding to a variety of community service programs – mainly focusing on education, public health and environmental stewardship – last spring.

item.title: Q&A: Professor Amada Armenta talks impact of immigration-related arrests on Los Angeles
item.description: United States Immigration and Customs Enforcement and U.S. Customs and Border Protection have arrested more than 10,000 people in Los Angeles since June, according to the U.S.
item.source:markdown: United States Immigration and Customs Enforcement and U.S. Customs and Border Protection have arrested more than 10,000 people in Los Angeles since June, according to the U.S.

item.title: Professor Julia Koerner teaches students to construct new architecture boundaries
item.description: When it comes to architecture, Julia Koerner is teaching students to think outside of the box. Koerner, an associate adjunct professor in UCLA Architecture and Urban Design with collaborations in Academy Award-winning costume designs, works on innovative design techniques – such as 3D printing – in the creation of sustainable architecture, fashion and other products.
item.source:markdown: When it comes to architecture, Julia Koerner is teaching students to think outside of the box. Koerner, an associate adjunct professor in UCLA Architecture and Urban Design with collaborations in Academy Award-winning costume designs, works on innovative design techniques – such as 3D printing – in the creation of sustainable architecture, fashion and other products.

item.title: Judge finalizes ruling against UCLA lecturer who sued UC administrators in 2021
item.description: This post was updated Jan. 8 at 10:04 p.m. A Santa Monica Superior Court judge officially sided with UC administrators Monday in a lawsuit brought by a UCLA lecturer who alleged he was unfairly put on leave in 2020 and requested $13 million in damages.   The move followed Judge H.
item.source:markdown: _This post was updated Jan. 8 at 10:04 p.m._ A Santa Monica Superior Court judge officially sided with UC administrators Monday in a lawsuit brought by a UCLA lecturer who alleged he was unfairly put on leave in 2020 and requested $13 million in damages. The move followed Judge H.

item.title: Band Night with UCLA’s music club
item.description: On Nov. 21, Music Club held its annual Band Night at the Kerckhoff Charles E. Young Grand Salon. Students came together to play and enjoy the free show organized by the club.
item.source:markdown: On Nov. 21, Music Club held its annual Band Night at the Kerckhoff Charles E. Young Grand Salon. Students came together to play and enjoy the free show organized by the club.

item.title: Opinion: Professors must teach sensitive topics in nuanced manner to avoid harm
item.description: I remember reading a theory about serial killers while sitting in a philosophy class. The author stated that childhood trauma reverted their brains to a preevolutionary state where they became hardwired to kill.
item.source:markdown: I remember reading a theory about serial killers while sitting in a philosophy class. The author stated that childhood trauma reverted their brains to a preevolutionary state where they became hardwired to kill.

item.title: Second Take: Harsh critical response to ‘Wicked: For Good’ shows overexposure does not go unpunished
item.description: This post was updated Jan. 8 at 7:52 p.m. Video advertising killed 2025’s star movie. After the success of 2024’s “Wicked,” which became the highest-grossing musical film adaptation, the popular assumption was that the sequel would be an effortless success.

item.title: AI summaries are coming to (for?) your Gmail
item.description: It’s the week of circling back on those emails to sources you sent in December, and soon Google may determine whether you get a reply. item.title: When just showing the video isn’t enough: Minneapolis shooting puts news organizations to the test
item.description: Late Wednesday afternoon, Fox 9 Minneapolis-St. Paul reported live from the Minneapolis block where an ICE agent shot and killed 37-year-old Renee Nicole Good. “There are a ton of videos on social media of the actual shooting because there were ICE watchers in the area as this was all unfolding,” the anchor explains in the...

item.title: Letter to the editor: Doubt should not stop students from creating meaningful work
item.description: When I read the article “UCLA student Jessica Rose pursues self-publishing, discusses commitment,” I immediately thought of my own experiences with self-publishing and co-authoring research. Her reflections on doubt and perseverance reminded me that the first steps toward a project, no matter how small, often feel the hardest, but they are the ones that make the biggest difference.
item.source:markdown: When I read the article “UCLA student Jessica Rose pursues self-publishing, discusses commitment,” I immediately thought of my own experiences with self-publishing and co-authoring research. Her reflections on doubt and perseverance reminded me that the first steps toward a project, no matter how small, often feel the hardest, but they are the ones that make the biggest difference.

It’s home to 10 Fortune 500 companies — more than 38 states can claim — and its big three pro sports teams have...

item.title: UCPD detains woman in relation to her child’s death, says no UCLA affiliation
item.description: A woman was arrested on UCLA’s campus Tuesday in relation to the death of her young child. She was originally detained around 12 p.m. after approaching UCPD officers near Murphy Hall, said Jeffrey Chobanian, the captain of UCPD’s operations bureau.
item.source:markdown: A woman was arrested on UCLA’s campus Tuesday in relation to the death of her young child. She was originally detained around 12 p.m. after approaching UCPD officers near Murphy Hall, said Jeffrey Chobanian, the captain of UCPD’s operations bureau.

item.title: Editorial Cartoon: “you got this”
Could this mysterious California news site influence the 2026 election?
item.description: Earlier this year, as the political battle over Congressional redistricting brought California into the national spotlight, Facebook users were shown a curious series of ads. The ads, from a straightforward-looking news site called the California Courier, often felt a lot like campaign commercials, linking to articles hammering Democrats in the state, including Gov. Gavin Newsom....
item.source:markdown: Earlier this year, as the political battle over Congressional redistricting brought California into the national spotlight, Facebook users were shown a curious series of ads. item.title: UCLA football faces come and go in transfer portal trade-off
item.description: Over 4,000 Division I football players have entered the transfer portal. With the window officially opening Jan. 2 and closing Jan. 16, many new faces will join the Bob Chesney train in Westwood and several will depart the Bruin program for good.
item.source:markdown: Over 4,000 Division I football players have entered the transfer portal. With the window officially opening Jan. 2 and closing Jan. 16, many new faces will join the Bob Chesney train in Westwood and several will depart the Bruin program for good.

item.title: Chesney unveils strong coaching staff, signals new era for UCLA football
item.description: This post was updated Jan. 6 at 11:57 p.m. Bob Chesney wasted no time bringing familiar faces to the West Coast. First, it was offensive coordinator Dean Kennedy, who spent two seasons with the now-UCLA head coach at Holy Cross and the past two years at James Madison, where he led the 11th-highest scoring offense in the FBS.
item.source:markdown: _This post was updated Jan. 6 at 11:57 p.m._ Bob Chesney wasted no time bringing familiar faces to the West Coast. First, it was offensive coordinator Dean Kennedy, who spent two seasons with the now-UCLA head coach at Holy Cross and the past two years at James Madison, where he led the 11th-highest scoring offense in the FBS.

item.title: Men’s basketball to face Wisconsin in likely-3-point-filled Big Ten contest
item.description: Saying that basketball is a game of runs is a cliche. But sometimes, teams truly embody the game’s hot-and-cold nature. UCLA men’s basketball (10-4, 2-1 Big Ten) will face one of the streakiest teams in the country Tuesday night in Wisconsin (9-5, 1-2) at the Kohl Center in Madison.
item.source:markdown: Saying that basketball is a game of runs is a cliche. But sometimes, teams truly embody the game’s hot-and-cold nature. item.title: The New York Times is staffing up in video
item.description: The New York Times has hired eight new journalists for its video department, the news organization announced today. Another 14 video-related roles remain open. item.title: Parts of Wilshire Boulevard to close this week for LA Metro construction

item.title: Westwood Village kicks off the season with its annual holiday tree lighting
item.description: Westwood Village welcomed the community for its third annual Holiday Tree Lighting celebration at Broxton Plaza where attendees enjoyed live music, free hot cocoa, family-friendly crafts, activities, and snowfall to kick off the holiday season.
item.source:markdown: Westwood Village welcomed the community for its third annual Holiday Tree Lighting celebration at Broxton Plaza where attendees enjoyed live music, free hot cocoa, family-friendly crafts, activities, and snowfall to kick off the holiday season.

item.title: Women’s water polo coach Adam Wright to step away from day-to-day duties
item.description: This post was updated Dec. 29 at 5:32 p.m. UCLA women’s water polo coach Adam Wright has stepped away from day-to-day operations of the program for the 2026 season, the university announced Monday.  “I have been dealing with a lot of back and nerve pain for the last six-plus months,” Wright said in a written statement provided by the university.
item.source:markdown: _This post was updated Dec. 29 at 5:32 p.m._ UCLA women’s water polo coach Adam Wright has stepped away from day-to-day operations of the program for the 2026 season, the university announced Monday. “I have been dealing with a lot of back and nerve pain for the last six-plus months,” Wright said in a written statement provided by the university.

item.title: UCLA women’s basketball fueled by second-chance points in victory over Ohio State
item.description: This post was updated Dec. 31 at 12:10 p.m. Under five seconds remained in the third quarter. Buckeye guard T’yana Todd knocked down a contested 3-pointer just as the shot clock struck zero.
item.source:markdown: _This post was updated Dec. 31 at 12:10 p.m._ Under five seconds remained in the third quarter. Buckeye guard T’yana Todd knocked down a contested 3-pointer just as the shot clock struck zero.

item.title: UCLA rounds out coaching staff, hires Colin Hitschler as defensive coordinator
item.description: The newest Bruin coaching trio is complete. UCLA is reportedly finalizing a deal to make James Madison’s Colin Hitschler the school’s next defensive coordinator, per ESPN.
item.source:markdown: The newest Bruin coaching trio is complete. UCLA is reportedly finalizing a deal to make James Madison’s Colin Hitschler the school’s next defensive coordinator, per ESPN.

item.title: UCLA professor Mark Tramo’s ties to Jeffrey Epstein raise mixed student reactions
item.description: Recently publicized communications between a UCLA professor and convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein sparked varying levels of disapproval among students. Mark Tramo – an associate adjunct professor of neurology at UCLA – sent emails to Epstein in 2007 and 2018, according to Bloomberg and emails released by the United States House of Representatives’ House Oversight Committee.
item.source:markdown: Recently publicized communications between a UCLA professor and convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein sparked varying levels of disapproval among students. Mark Tramo – an associate adjunct professor of neurology at UCLA – sent emails to Epstein in 2007 and 2018, according to Bloomberg and emails released by the United States House of Representatives’ House Oversight Committee.

item.title: Court tentatively rules in favor of UC administrators in lawsuit by UCLA lecturer
item.description: A Superior Court judge in Santa Monica tentatively ruled in favor of UC administrators in a lawsuit brought by a UCLA lecturer requesting more than $13 million in damages.
item.source:markdown: A Superior Court judge in Santa Monica tentatively ruled in favor of UC administrators in a lawsuit brought by a UCLA lecturer requesting more than $13 million in damages.

item.title: US Court of Appeals upholds UCLA’s lease with Department of Veterans Affairs
item.description: UCLA’s 10-acre lease with the Department of Veterans Affairs, which includes Jackie Robinson Stadium, was upheld by the United States Court of Appeals Ninth Circuit on Tuesday.
item.source:markdown: UCLA’s 10-acre lease with the Department of Veterans Affairs, which includes Jackie Robinson Stadium, was upheld by the United States Court of Appeals Ninth Circuit on Tuesday.

item.title: Evaluation shows some LAPD mental health protocols don’t support at risk people
item.description: Some law enforcement protocols for handling mental health crises are not effective in supporting people at risk, according to UCLA experts and a fall evaluation of LAPD from the city controller.
item.source:markdown: Some law enforcement protocols for handling mental health crises are not effective in supporting people at risk, according to UCLA experts and a fall evaluation of LAPD from the city controller.

item.title: Bilodeau leads UCLA men’s basketball to 97-65 blowout win over UC Riverside
item.description: This post was updated Dec. 23 at 7:12 p.m. There are three guarantees in life. Death, taxes and Tyler Bilodeau. Over the Bruins’ last 45 games, there has been no one more reliable than the senior forward.
item.source:markdown: _This post was updated Dec. 23 at 7:12 p.m._ There are three guarantees in life. Death, taxes and Tyler Bilodeau. Over the Bruins’ last 45 games, there has been no one more reliable than the senior forward.

item.title: UCLA swim and dive ends year with inconsistent results at multiple invites

item.title: UCLA men’s basketball prepares for UC Riverside game, final nonconference matchup
item.description: The opponent does not matter. In sports, but especially college basketball, it can be anyone’s night on any given day. And the Bruins saw that firsthand against the Mustangs Friday.
item.source:markdown: The opponent does not matter. In sports, but especially college basketball, it can be anyone’s night on any given day. And the Bruins saw that firsthand against the Mustangs Friday.

item.title: Quarterback Nico Iamaleava to return to UCLA football for 2026 season
item.description: He is back. Nico Iamaleava – one of the highest-ranked recruits to join the Bruins in program history – will return to UCLA for his redshirt junior season, he announced Monday evening via Instagram.
item.source:markdown: He is back. Nico Iamaleava – one of the highest-ranked recruits to join the Bruins in program history – will return to UCLA for his redshirt junior season, he announced Monday evening via Instagram.

item.title: UCLA women’s basketball submerges Long Beach State with 2nd triple-digit outing
item.description: This post was updated Dec. 20 at 7:30 p.m. Coach Cori Close preaches consistency as the standard for her team. Remaining consistent, though, is difficult to do when the bar is an 87-point victory.
